#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Murād Mīrzā
#Text=Murād Mīrzā
#Text=( Arabic : مراد ميرزا‎‎ ; 1509-1514 ?
#Text=-1574 ) was the 36th Imam of the Nizari Ismaili Shia Islam community .
#Text=Life
#Text=He was a politically active Imam , possibly alongside the Nuqtavi Shia group , and had a large following . [ 1 ]
#Text=Murād Mīrzā did not always operate from the Nizari base of Anjudan .
#Text=As a result of his activeness , he acquired followers in Kashan and other central Persian areas .
#Text=Ali Shah , surnamed Shah Murad or Murad Mirza lived in Anjudan .
#Text=He had also retained his close relations with Shah Ismail cemented by his father .
#Text=His mode of living , his dress and food were characterised by a rare simplicity .
#Text=The Ottoman sultan Salim ( 1512-1520 ) began his long march to northern Azerbaijan after putting 40,000 Shias to death in his dominions .
#Text=He reached the plain of Chaldiran and the outbreak of war occurred in 920/1514 .
#Text=He inflicted a defeat to Shah Ismail .
#Text=The Ottoman firepower , consisting of 200 cannon and 100 mortars was brought into play with devastating effect .
#Text=After suffering heavy casualties , the Safavid artilleries were forced to break off the engagement .
#Text=When Shah Ismail left the battlefield , sultan Salim did not pursue him . Later , he marched to Tabriz , the Safavid capital , which he occupied in 922/1517 .
#Text=Caterino Zeno , the Venetian ambassador writes in " Travels in Persia " ( p. 61 ) that , "
